title: Spanish Tempeh with Baby potatoes & Aubergine with Tempeh & Aubergine
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Prepare the fresh components on a board.
Mix tempeh with harissa and a pinch of salt.
Layer with aubergine, courgette and baby potatoes.
Cook baby potatoes until tender (20–25 min boiled).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Baby potatoes or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

Season salmon fillet and place on the tray. Roast for 24 min, turning once.
Cook the jasmine rice according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Salmon for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Jasmine rice or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: British Black beans traybake with Black Beans & Beans Tray Bake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the air fryer to 190°C.
Toss green beans and onion with half the almonds, salt, pepper and ras el hanout; spread on a tray.
Season black beans and place on the tray. Air-fry for 25 min, turning once.
Cook the polenta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Polenta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Australian Chicken breast with Bulgur wheat & Spinach with Chicken & Bulgur
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 210°C.
Toss spinach and onion with half the peanut butter, salt, pepper and ras el hanout; spread on a tray.
Season chicken breast and place on the tray. Roast for 26 min, turning once.
Cook the bulgur wheat according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Chicken for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Bulgur wheat or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Eggs and Kale Roast with Eggs & Pasta
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 200°C.
Toss kale and peas with half the almonds, salt, pepper and ras el hanout; spread on a tray.
Season eggs and place on the tray. Roast for 40 min, turning once.
Cook the whole-wheat pasta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Whole-wheat pasta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Peruvian Halloumi traybake with Halloumi & Bulgur Tray Bake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat rapeseed oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook halloumi 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry garlic and aubergine with harissa 14 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the bulgur wheat according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Bulgur wheat or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Chicken breast and Courgette Grill with Chicken & Beans
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat grill to high.
Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook chicken breast 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry courgette and green beans with garam masala 11 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Chicken for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Pitta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Onion & Peas Pitta with Chickpeas with Chickpeas & Pepper
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Prepare the fresh components on a board.
Mix chickpeas with lemon & herb and a pinch of salt.
Layer with onion, peas and pitta.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Pitta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Tofu (firm) and Green beans Stir-Fry — Pakistani with Tofu & Beans
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat peanut butter in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook tofu (firm) 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry green beans and spinach with italian herbs 12 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Tortilla wrap or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.
